questions.question:
Explanation:
You work as a senior developer at ABC.com. The ABC.com network consists of a single domain
named ABC.com.
You are running a training exercise for junior developers. You are currently discussing the use of a
collection type that represents a doubly linked list.
Which of the following is the collection type being discussed?

distractors.text: The LinkedList<T> collection type.
The SortedSet<T> collection type.
The SortedList<T> collection type.
The List<T>collection type.

garbage collection by the common language is pending.

questions.question:

questions.question:
Explanation:

ABC.com.
You have been tasked with creating an application allows users to enter time and dates. You are
writing code that includes a DateTime method, which converts the indicated string representation

specified format exactly. The method then returns a value that indicates whether the conversion
was successful.
Which of the following is the DateTime method that is being included?

distractors.text: TryParseExact(String, String[], IFormatProvider, DateTimeStyles, DateTime)
TryParseExact(String, String, IFormatProvider, DateTimeStyles, DateTime)
TryParse(String, IFormatProvider, DateTimeStyles, DateTime)
TryParse(String, DateTime)

questions.question:
Explanation:

ABC.com.

Microsoft 70-483 Exam
  14
algorithm.
probability that is better than one half.
algorithm.

distractors.text: It performs symmetric encryption and decryption using the CAPI implementation of the AES
It classifies a wrapper object to access the CSP version of the DES algorithm.
It allows for the generation of output that is computationally infeasible to predict with a
It allows for the authenticity of the information to be guaranteed via a cryptographic hashing

distractors.text: You should consider including a difference counter in your code.
You should consider including a percentage counter in your code.
You should consider including an average counter in your code.
You should consider including a base counter in your code.

Explanation:

distractors.text: To prevent any thread from accessing the object.
To make sure that when a single thread attempts to access the object, a deadlock occurs.
To allow only a single thread access to the object at a time.
To allow multiple threads access to the object.

methods on the extended type.

}

accepts no parameters.

questions.question:
Explanation:
You work as a developer at ABC.com. The ABC.com network consists of a single domain named
ABC.com.
You have written the following code segment:
int[] filteredEmployeeIds = employeeIds.Distinct().Where(value => value !=
employeeIdToRemove).OrderByDescending(x => x).ToArray();
Which of the following describes reasons for writing this code? (Choose two.)

distractors.text: To remove all integers from the employeeIds array.
To remove duplicate integers from the employeeIds array.
To sort the array in order from the lowest value to the highest value.
To sort the array in order from the highest value to the lowest value.

questions.question:

named ABC.com.

the Queue <T> collection type.

IComparer<T> implementation.

distractors.text: It represents a list of objects that can be accessed by index.
It represents a collection of key/value pairs that are sorted by key based on the associated
It represents a last in, first out (LIFO) collection of objects.
It represents a first in, first out (FIFO) collection of objects.
